Our Approach

At IKAA Hospital, we take a holistic approach to lung transplantation, ensuring that every step of your journey towards a healthier life is meticulously planned and executed. Our team of highly skilled and compassionate medical professionals includes pulmonologists, thoracic surgeons, cardiac surgeons, infectious disease specialists, and psychiatrists, among others. These experts collaborate as a multidisciplinary team to provide you with coordinated, comprehensive care. Our commitment to your well-being begins with a thorough evaluation, where our medical professionals assess your specific needs and condition. They work together to determine your eligibility for a lung transplant, taking into account various factors, including medical history and current health status. Once you are deemed a suitable candidate for a lung transplant, our dedicated team of surgeons, with vast experience in chest and cardiac surgery, will perform the transplant procedure with the utmost precision and care. Throughout the surgical process, your safety and comfort are our top priorities.

After a successful lung transplant, the support doesn't end in the operating room. We continue to stand by your side, providing post-transplant care and monitoring to ensure your ongoing health and well-being. Our healthcare professionals will coordinate follow-up care, medication management, and rehabilitation to help you make a smooth and healthy recovery.

Cost and Insurance

At IKAA Hospital, we understand that navigating the financial aspects of kidney transplant can be overwhelming. That's why we have dedicated transplant financial services representatives and compassionate social workers who are ready to assist you every step of the way. We are committed to providing you with the support and information you need regarding the costs and insurance coverage for your kidney transplant.

Insurance Partners

IKAA Hospital collaborates with a wide range of insurance companies, ensuring that we are an in-network provider for a substantial number of individuals. This extensive network is designed to make the kidney transplant process as accessible as possible for our patients. In most cases, a physician referral to XYZ Hospital is not a requirement to initiate the transplant evaluation process.
